     <section ids="feature-toggles featuretoggles" names="feature\ toggles featuretoggles">
         <title>Feature Toggles</title>
         <paragraph>This is the list of all Open edX feature toggles used in edx-platform. These feature toggles can be used to enable or disable features manually on every platform.</paragraph>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-">
+            <title ids="name-"></title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-">Default: <literal>"Not defined"</literal></paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="source-ALLOW_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CREATION">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/openedx/envs/common.py#L884">openedx/envs/common.py (line 884)</reference></paragraph>

+            <title ids="name-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/openedx/envs/common.py#L720">openedx/envs/common.py (line 720)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Desc: Set to True to perform acceptance and load test. Auto auth view is responsible for load
+                    testing and is controlled by this feature flag. Session verification (of CacheBackedAuthenticationMiddleware)
+                    is a security feature, but it can be turned off by enabling this feature flag.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">
+                <paragraph>If this has been set to True then the account activation email will be skipped.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Creation Date: 2013-07-25</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-AUTOMATIC_AUTH_FOR_TESTING">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>

+            <paragraph ids="description-EDX_DRF_EXTENSIONS[ENABLE_SET_REQUEST_USER_FOR_JWT_COOKIE]">Desc: Toggle for setting request.user with jwt cookie authentication. This makes the JWT cookie
+                      user available to middleware while processing the request, if the session user wasn’t already available. This
+                      requires JwtAuthCookieMiddleware to work.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-EDX_DRF_EXTENSIONS[ENABLE_SET_REQUEST_USER_FOR_JWT_COOKIE]">
+                <paragraph>This feature caused a memory leak in edx-platform. This toggle is temporary only if we can make it
+                          work in all services, or find a replacement. Consider making this a permanent toggle instead.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-EDX_DRF_EXTENSIONS[ENABLE_SET_REQUEST_USER_FOR_JWT_COOKIE]">Creation Date: 2019-10-15</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-EMBARGO">
+            <title ids="name-EMBARGO">EMBARGO</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-EMBARGO">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-EMBARGO">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/openedx/envs/common.py#L744">openedx/envs/common.py (line 744)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-EMBARGO">Desc: Turns on embargo functionality, which blocks users from
+                   the site or courses based on their location. Embargo can restrict users by states
+                   and whitelist/blacklist (IP Addresses (ie. 10.0.0.0), Networks (ie. 10.0.0.0/24)), or the user profile country.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-EMBARGO">
+                <paragraph>reverse proxy should be configured appropriately for example Client IP address headers
+                       (e.g HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR) should be configured.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-EMBARGO">Creation Date: 2014-02-27</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-EMBARGO">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-EMBARGO">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
         <section ids="featuretoggle-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">
             <title ids="name-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY</title>
             <paragraph ids="default-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="source-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/b0588452088a6dd48e865f51d27e8d0e6f609bdc/cms/envs/common.py#L630">cms/envs/common.py (line 630)</reference></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Desc: When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
-                   on Authn MFE’s login.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L3273">lms/envs/common.py (line 3273)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Desc: When enabled, this toggle prevents the use of known-vulnerable passwords in
+                   the login flow if their frequency exceeds a threshold. Passwords are assessed by calling the
+                   Pwned Passwords service using a k-anonymity method that does not expose the password. The
+                   service tells us whether the password has been seen in any data breaches, and if so, how
+                   often. This count is converted to a “frequency” by taking the logarithm base 10. The login flow
+                   can reject all vulnerable passwords, or only passwords with a frequency above a configured
+                   threshold. In existing deployments, the threshold should be set high and tightened
+                   gradually in order to avoid large spikes in password resets and support requests. For example,
+                   setting ``HIBP_LOGIN_BLOCK_PASSWORD_FREQUENCY_THRESHOLD`` to 5 would reject logins when the
+                   password has been seen 100,000 or more times in the Pwned Passwords dataset. The goal should be
+                   to gradually reduce this to 0, meaning even a single occurrence will cause a rejection. (The
+                   threshold can take any real-number value.)</paragraph>
             <paragraph ids="creation_date-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Creation Date: 2022-03-29</paragraph>
             <paragraph ids="implementation-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="use_cases-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Use Cases: [‘temporary’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
         </section>
         <section ids="featuretoggle-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">
             <title ids="name-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY</title>
             <paragraph ids="default-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>

-            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Desc: When enabled, this toggle activates the use of the password validation
-                   on Authn MFE’s login.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L3258">lms/envs/common.py (line 3258)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Desc: When enabled, the login flow detects vulnerable passwords
+                   and prompts users to change their password if their frequency exceeds a threshold.
+                   See ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_BLOCK_HIBP_POLICY for more details.</paragraph>
             <paragraph ids="creation_date-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Creation Date: 2022-03-29</paragraph>
             <paragraph ids="implementation-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="use_cases-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Use Cases: [‘temporary’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-ENABLE_AUTHN_LOGIN_NUDGE_HIBP_POLICY">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED">Desc: Write Courseware Student Module History (CSMH) to the extended table: this logs all
+                   student activities to MySQL, in a separate database.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED">
+                <paragraph>Even though most Open edX instances run with a separate CSMH database, it may not always be
+                       the case. When disabling this feature flag, remember to remove “lms.djangoapps.coursewarehistoryextended”
+                       from the INSTALLED_APPS and the “StudentModuleHistoryExtendedRouter” from the DATABASE_ROUTERS. This is needed
+                       in the LMS and CMS for migration consistency.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED">Creation Date: 2020-11-05</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">
+            <title ids="name-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Default: <literal>True</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/openedx/envs/common.py#L644">openedx/envs/common.py (line 644)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Desc: When True, it will enable the Discussion tab in courseware for all courses. Setting this
+                   to False will not contain inline discussion components and discussion tab in any courses.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">
+                <paragraph>If the discussion panel is present in the course and the value for this flag is False then,
+                       attempting to expand those components will cause errors. So, this should only be set to False with an LMS that
+                       is running courses that do not contain discussion components.
+                       For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the CMS.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Creation Date: 2012-08-14</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_PASSWORD_RESET_FAILURE_EMAIL">Desc: Whether to send an email for failed password reset attempts or not. This happens when a
+                   user asks for a password reset but they don’t have an account associated to their email. This is useful for
+                   notifying users that they don’t have an account associated with email addresses they believe they’ve registered

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">
+            <title ids="name-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/common/djangoapps/third_party_auth/toggles.py#L21">common/djangoapps/third_party_auth/toggles.py (line 21)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">Desc: Controls whether SAML configuration signal handlers are active.
+                    When enabled (True), signal handlers will automatically update SAMLProviderConfig
+                    references when the associated SAMLConfiguration is updated.
+                    When disabled (False), SAMLProviderConfigs point to outdated SAMLConfiguration.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">
+                <paragraph>Disabling this toggle may result in SAMLProviderConfig instances
+                        pointing to outdated SAMLConfiguration records. Use the management command
+                        ‘saml –fix-references’ to fix outdated references.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">Creation Date: 2025-07-03</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="target_removal_date-ENABLE_SAML_CONFIG_SIGNAL_HANDLERS">Target Removal Date: 2026-01-01</paragraph>

-            <paragraph ids="description-FEATURES['AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING']">Desc: If set to True, then we want to skip posting anything to Software Secure. Bypass posting
-                   anything to Software Secure if the auto verify feature for testing is enabled. We actually don’t even create
-                   the message because that would require encryption and message signing that rely on settings.VERIFY_STUDENT
-                   values that aren’t set in dev. So we just pretend like we successfully posted and automatically approve student
-                   identity verification attempts.</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="creation_date-FEATURES['AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING']">Creation Date: 2013-10-03</paragraph>

-        <section ids="featuretoggle-FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']">
-            <title ids="name-FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']">FEATURES[‘ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN’]</title>
-            <paragraph ids="default-FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="source-FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/b0588452088a6dd48e865f51d27e8d0e6f609bdc/cms/envs/common.py#L396">cms/envs/common.py (line 396)</reference></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="description-FEATURES['ENABLE_CHANGE_USER_PASSWORD_ADMIN']">Desc: Set to True to enable changing a user password through django admin. This is disabled by
-                   default because enabling allows a method to bypass password policy.</paragraph>

-                   student activities to MySQL, in a separate database.</paragraph>
-            <warning ids="warning-FEATURES['ENABLE_CSMH_EXTENDED']">
-                <paragraph>Even though most Open edX instances run with a separate CSMH database, it may not always be
-                       the case. When disabling this feature flag, remember to remove “lms.djangoapps.coursewarehistoryextended”
-                       from the INSTALLED_APPS and the “StudentModuleHistoryExtendedRouter” from the DATABASE_ROUTERS.</paragraph>
-            </warning>

-        <section ids="featuretoggle-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">
-            <title ids="name-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">FEATURES[‘ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST’]</title>
-            <paragraph ids="default-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="source-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/b0588452088a6dd48e865f51d27e8d0e6f609bdc/lms/envs/common.py#L171">lms/envs/common.py (line 171)</reference></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="description-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Desc: Set this to True if you want the discussion digest emails
-                   enabled automatically for new users. This will be set on all new account
-                   registrations.</paragraph>
-            <warning ids="warning-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">
-                <paragraph>It is not recommended to enable this feature if ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL is not enabled,
-                       since subscribers who receive digests in that case will only be able to unsubscribe via links embedded in
-                       their emails, and they will have no way to resubscribe.</paragraph>
-            </warning>
-            <paragraph ids="creation_date-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Creation Date: 2014-08-19</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="implementation-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="use_cases-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST']">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>

-            <paragraph ids="description-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE']">Desc: When True, it will enable the Discussion tab in courseware for all courses. Setting this
-                   to False will not contain inline discussion components and discussion tab in any courses.</paragraph>
-            <warning ids="warning-FEATURES['ENABLE_DISCUSSION_SERVICE']">
-                <paragraph>If the discussion panel is present in the course and the value for this flag is False then,
-                       attempting to expand those components will cause errors. So, this should only be set to False with an LMS that
-                       is running courses that do not contain discussion components.
-                       For consistency in user-experience, keep the value in sync with the setting of the same name in the CMS.</paragraph>
-            </warning>

-        <section ids="featuretoggle-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">
-            <title ids="name-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">FEATURES[‘ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS’]</title>
-            <paragraph ids="default-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Default: <literal>True</literal></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="source-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/b0588452088a6dd48e865f51d27e8d0e6f609bdc/lms/envs/common.py#L426">lms/envs/common.py (line 426)</reference></paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="description-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Desc: This feature will keep track of the number of failed login attempts on a given user’s
-                   email. If the number of consecutive failed login attempts - without a successful login at some point - reaches
-                   a configurable threshold (default 6), then the account will be locked for a configurable amount of seconds
-                   (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. If a user
-                   successfully logs in, all the counter which tracks the number of failed attempts will be reset back to 0. If
-                   set to False then account locking will be disabled for failed login attempts.</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="creation_date-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Creation Date: 2014-01-30</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="implementation-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
-            <paragraph ids="use_cases-FEATURES['ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS']">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
-        </section>

+            <paragraph ids="source-RBAC_IGNORE_INVALID_JWT_COOKIE">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/edx_rbac/constants.py#L7">.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/edx_rbac/constants.py (line 7)</reference></paragraph>

+                   to be ignored instead of raised in the `get_decoded_jwt()` utility function.
+                   Defaults to False for backward-compatibility purposes, but it’s recommended
+                   to be set to True in dependent applications.</paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="description-RESTRICT_AUTOMATIC_AUTH">Desc: Prevent auto auth from creating superusers or modifying existing users. Auto auth is a
+                   mechanism where superusers can simply modify attributes of other users by accessing the “/auto_auth url” with

+            <paragraph ids="description-course_assets.allow_download_code_library">Desc: Whether to allow learners to download the course code library
+                   that is used for custom Python-graded problem blocks. (This is conventionally
+                   ``python_lib.zip``, but configurable with Django setting ``PYTHON_LIB_FILENAME``).
+                   This file may contain custom grading code or problem answers that should not be
+                   revealed to learners.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-course_assets.allow_download_code_library">
+                <paragraph>This flag is only intended as a temporary override for use
+                       in rollout, to be removed before Ulmo. Courses that rely on learners being able
+                       to download the code library should find an alternative workflow, or the toggle
+                       should be re-documented as permanent.</paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="description-edxval.override_existing_imported_transcripts">Desc: Enables overriding existing transcripts when importing courses with already
+                   existing transcripts. The transcripts are compared using content hashing, and if the transcript
+                   being imported isn’t a duplicate, but different in content, it overrides the existing one.
+                   Otherwise, if the transcript is a duplicate, with same content, it doesn’t get uploaded.</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-my_toggle_name&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ CorrectlyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel):&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ DisabeldNoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ \ #pylint:\ disable=feature-toggle-needs-doc&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ #\ ..\ wrong_annotation&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ WronglyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ #=A&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ NoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ #=B&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ NotAConfigurationModelClass():&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ def\ __init__(self,\ value):&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ self.value\ =\ value">
+            <title ids="name-my_toggle_name&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ CorrectlyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel):&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ DisabeldNoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ \ #pylint:\ disable=feature-toggle-needs-doc&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ #\ ..\ wrong_annotation&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ WronglyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ #=A&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ NoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel):\ #=B&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ my_toggle_name\ =\ models.BooleanField(default=True)&#10;&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ class\ NotAConfigurationModelClass():&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ def\ __init__(self,\ value):&#10;\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ self.value\ =\ value">my_toggle_name
+                        class CorrectlyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel):
+                            my_toggle_name = models.BooleanField(default=True)
+                
+                        class DisabeldNoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel):  #pylint: disable=feature-toggle-needs-doc
+                            my_toggle_name = models.BooleanField(default=True)
+                
+                        # .. wrong_annotation
+                        class WronglyAnnotatedConfig(ConfigurationModel): #=A
+                            my_toggle_name = models.BooleanField(default=True)
+                
+                        class NoAnnotationsConfig(ConfigurationModel): #=B
+                            my_toggle_name = models.BooleanField(default=True)
+                
+                        class NotAConfigurationModelClass():
+                            def __init__(self, value):
+                                self.value = value</title>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">
+            <title ids="name-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L269">lms/envs/common.py (line 269)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">Desc: If set to True, then we want to skip posting anything to Software Secure. Bypass posting
+                   anything to Software Secure if the auto verify feature for testing is enabled. We actually don’t even create
+                   the message because that would require encryption and message signing that rely on settings.VERIFY_STUDENT
+                   values that aren’t set in dev. So we just pretend like we successfully posted and automatically approve student
+                   identity verification attempts.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">Creation Date: 2013-10-03</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.AUTOMATIC_VERIFY_STUDENT_IDENTITY_FOR_TESTING">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">
+            <title ids="name-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Default: <literal>True</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L178">lms/envs/common.py (line 178)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Desc: When this is set to True, all the courses will be listed on the /courses page and Explore
+                   Courses link will be visible. Set to False if courses list and Explore Courses link need to be hidden.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">
+                <paragraph>This Effects views and templates.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Creation Date: 2013-09-28</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.COURSES_ARE_BROWSABLE">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">
+            <title ids="name-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L436">lms/envs/common.py (line 436)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">Desc: Set to True to enable custom certificate templates which are configured via Django admin.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">Creation Date: 2015-08-13</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.CUSTOM_CERTIFICATE_TEMPLATES_ENABLED">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>

+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">
+            <title ids="name-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Default: <literal>True</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/cms/envs/common.py#L176">cms/envs/common.py (line 176)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Desc: Warn about removing support for deprecated course keys.
+                      To enable, set to True.
+                      To disable, set to False.
+                      To enable with a custom support deadline, set to an ISO-8601 date string:
+                        eg: ‘2020-09-01’</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">
+                <paragraph>This can be removed once support is removed for deprecated
+                       course keys.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Creation Date: 2020-06-12</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="target_removal_date-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Target Removal Date: 2021-04-01</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.DEPRECATE_OLD_COURSE_KEYS_IN_STUDIO">Use Cases: [‘temporary’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.DISABLE_ADVANCED_SETTINGS">

+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.DISABLE_ADVANCED_SETTINGS">Desc: Set to `True` to disable the advanced settings page in Studio for all users except those
+                   having `is_superuser` or `is_staff` set to `True`.</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">
+            <title ids="name-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/cms/envs/common.py#L192">cms/envs/common.py (line 192)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Desc: If set to True, it disables the course creation functionality and hides the “New Course”
+                   button in studio.
+                   It is important to note that the value of this flag only affects if the user doesn’t have a staff role,
+                   otherwise the course creation functionality will work as it should.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">
+                <paragraph>Another toggle DISABLE_LIBRARY_CREATION overrides DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION, if present.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Creation Date: 2013-12-02</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.DISABLE_COURSE_CREATION">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES">
+            <title ids="name-settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES">settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L227">lms/envs/common.py (line 227)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.DISABLE_HONOR_CERTIFICATES">Desc: Set to True to disable honor certificates. Typically used when your installation only
+                   allows verified certificates, like courses.edx.org.</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">
+            <title ids="name-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L88">lms/envs/common.py (line 88)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">Desc: This displays histograms in the Staff Debug Info panel to course staff.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">
+                <paragraph>Generating histograms requires scanning the courseware_studentmodule table on each view. This
+                       can make staff access to courseware very slow on large courses.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">Creation Date: 2014-02-13</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.DISPLAY_HISTOGRAMS_TO_STAFF">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/cms/envs/common.py#L133">cms/envs/common.py (line 133)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Desc: When set to True, Content Libraries in
+                    Studio can be used as an LTI 1.3 tool by external LTI platforms.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Creation Date: 2021-08-17</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_CONTENT_LIBRARIES_LTI_TOOL">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_COOKIE_CONSENT">

+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COOKIE_CONSENT">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_COOKIE_CONSENT">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L508">lms/envs/common.py (line 508)</reference></paragraph>

+                   https://cookieconsent.insites.com/</paragraph>

+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE">settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L258">lms/envs/common.py (line 258)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE">Desc: Enable the display of “cosmetic_display_price”, set in a course advanced settings. This
+                   cosmetic price is used when there is no registration price associated to the course.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_COSMETIC_DISPLAY_PRICE">
+                <paragraph>The use case of this feature toggle is uncertain.</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L395">lms/envs/common.py (line 395)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Desc: When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware
+                   pages for searching courseware data.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">
+                <paragraph>In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. You will
+                       see the search widget on the courseware page only if the DISABLE_COURSE_OUTLINE_PAGE_FLAG is set.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Creation Date: 2015-01-29</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L408">lms/envs/common.py (line 408)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Desc: When enabled, this adds a Search the course widget on the course outline and courseware
+                   pages for searching courseware data but for course staff users only.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">
+                <paragraph>In order to get this working, your courses data should be indexed in Elasticsearch. If
+                       ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH is enabled then the search widget will be visible to all learners and this flag’s
+                       value does not matter in that case. This flag is enabled in devstack by default.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Creation Date: 2019-12-06</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_FOR_COURSE_STAFF">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_VERIFIED_REQUIRED">

+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COURSEWARE_SEARCH_VERIFIED_REQUIRED">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L447">lms/envs/common.py (line 447)</reference></paragraph>

+                   latest courses are no longer displayed on the LMS landing page. Also, an “Explore Courses” item is added to the
+                   navbar.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_COURSE_DISCOVERY">
+                <paragraph>The COURSE_DISCOVERY_MEANINGS setting should be properly defined.</paragraph>

+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L112">lms/envs/common.py (line 112)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">Desc: Set this to True if you want the discussion digest emails
+                   enabled automatically for new users. This will be set on all new account
+                   registrations.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">
+                <paragraph>It is not recommended to enable this feature if ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL is not enabled,
+                       since subscribers who receive digests in that case will only be able to unsubscribe via links embedded in
+                       their emails, and they will have no way to resubscribe.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">Creation Date: 2014-08-19</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_EMAIL_DIGEST">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>

+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L101">lms/envs/common.py (line 101)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL">Desc: Hides or displays a welcome panel under the Discussion tab, which includes a subscription
+                   on/off setting for discussion digest emails.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_DISCUSSION_HOME_PANEL">
+                <paragraph>This should remain off in production until digest notifications are online.</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/openedx/envs/common.py#L772">openedx/envs/common.py (line 772)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Desc: This toggle enables the students to save and manage their annotations in the
+                   course using the notes service. The bulk of the actual work in storing the notes is done by
+                   a separate service (see the edx-notes-api repo).</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">
+                <paragraph>Requires the edx-notes-api service properly running and to have configured the django settings
+                       EDXNOTES_INTERNAL_API and EDXNOTES_PUBLIC_API. If you update this setting, also update it in Studio.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Creation Date: 2015-01-04</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Implementation: [‘SettingToggle’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_EDXNOTES">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L375">lms/envs/common.py (line 375)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Desc: Set to True if you want show the mobile app links (Apple App Store &amp; Google Play Store) in
+                   the footer.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">
+                <paragraph>If you set this to True then you should also set your mobile application’s app store and play
+                       store URLs in the MOBILE_STORE_URLS settings dictionary. These links are not part of the default theme. If you
+                       want these links on your footer then you should use the edx.org theme.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Creation Date: 2015-01-13</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_FOOTER_MOBILE_APP_LINKS">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI">settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_HIDE_FROM_TOC_UI">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/cms/envs/common.py#L237">cms/envs/common.py (line 237)</reference></paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">Default: <literal>False</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L545">lms/envs/common.py (line 545)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">Desc: Whether HTML Block returns HTML content with the Course Blocks API when the API
+                   is called with student_view_data=html query parameter.</paragraph>
+            <warning ids="warning-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">
+                <paragraph>Because the Course Blocks API caches its data, the cache must be cleared (e.g. by
+                       re-publishing the course) for changes to this flag to take effect.</paragraph>
+            </warning>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">Creation Date: 2017-08-28</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_HTML_XBLOCK_STUDENT_VIEW_DATA">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>

+        <section ids="featuretoggle-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">
+            <title ids="name-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS</title>
+            <paragraph ids="default-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Default: <literal>True</literal></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="source-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Source: <reference refuri="https://github.com/openedx/edx-platform/blob/cf48323639bf24eed5ef120dfbd9e98cf0fd64af/lms/envs/common.py#L293">lms/envs/common.py (line 293)</reference></paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="description-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Desc: This feature will keep track of the number of failed login attempts on a given user’s
+                   email. If the number of consecutive failed login attempts - without a successful login at some point - reaches
+                   a configurable threshold (default 6), then the account will be locked for a configurable amount of seconds
+                   (30 minutes) which will prevent additional login attempts until this time period has passed. If a user
+                   successfully logs in, all the counter which tracks the number of failed attempts will be reset back to 0. If
+                   set to False then account locking will be disabled for failed login attempts.</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="creation_date-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Creation Date: 2014-01-30</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="implementation-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Implementation: [‘DjangoSetting’]</paragraph>
+            <paragraph ids="use_cases-settings.ENABLE_MAX_FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS">Use Cases: [‘open_edx’]</paragraph>
+        </section>
